Compliance Requirement

Why Trust AccountAudits Are Required

Understanding the legal requirements and importance of annual trust account audits in Australia.

Legal Requirement

Australian law mandates annual trust account audits for law firms and real estate agencies.

  • Corporations Act 2001
  • Legal Profession Acts
  • Real Estate Regulations
  • ASIC Requirements

Client Protection

Trust account audits protect client funds and ensure proper handling of money held in trust.

  • Client fund security
  • Fraud prevention
  • Proper segregation
  • Interest compliance

Compliance Verification

Independent verification ensures your trust account practices meet regulatory standards.

  • Record keeping
  • Transaction verification
  • Reconciliation checks
  • Reporting standards

Think of us as the referee in a game

We don't hold the money, we verify how it's used

Just like a referee ensures fair play in sports, AuditsPro acts as an independent third-party to verify that your trust account practices are compliant with Australian regulations.

  • We're independent third-party verifiers
  • We ensure fair play with client funds
  • We check the rules are being followed
  • We provide official confirmation of compliance

Independent Verification

We verify compliance without holding your funds

How AuditsPro Works as an Independent Auditing Agency

Our systematic approach ensures thorough, independent assessment of your trust account compliance.

01

Independent Assessment

We operate as a completely independent third-party, ensuring unbiased evaluation of your trust account practices.

02

Comprehensive Review

Our ASIC registered auditors conduct thorough examinations of all trust account transactions and procedures.

03

Compliance Verification

We verify that your practices meet all current Australian regulatory requirements and best practices.

04

Detailed Reporting

You receive comprehensive reports with clear findings, recommendations, and compliance confirmations.
